caption.center: STATE OF MISSOURI, PLAINTIFF/RESPONDENT, v. CURTIS L. JOHNSON,
CURTIS L. JOHNSON, MOVANT/APPELLANT, v. STATE OF MISSOURI,

court.center: Missouri Court of Appeals, Eastern District,

opinion.opinion_text: [1] [EDITORS' NOTE: THIS OPINION IS SUBJECT TO MODIFICATION OR TRANSFER TO THE SUPREME COURT.]
opinion.posture: Appeal from the Circuit Court of St. Louis County Hon. Bernhardt C. Drumm, Jr.
opinion.panel: Before Kathianne Knaup Crane, P.J., Gerald M. Smith and James A. Pudlowski, JJ.
opinion.opinion_text:
[3] Defendant Curtis Johnson appeals his conviction after a jury trial of two counts of first degree assault (Counts I and III), in violation of ยง 565.050 RSMo 1994 and two counts of armed criminal action (Counts II and IV), in violation of ยง 571.015 RSMo 1994, on which he was sentenced to consecutive terms of twenty years on Counts I and III and concurrent terms of twenty years on Counts II and IV. Johnson also appeals from a judgment denying on the merits, after an evidentiary hearing, his Rule 29.15 motion.
[4] No error of law appears and no jurisprudential purpose would be served by a written opinion. However, the parties have been furnished with a memorandum opinion for their information only, setting forth the facts and reasons for this order.
[5] The judgment is affirmed in accordance with Rules 30.25(b) and 84.16(b).
